revised_title: Insect Physiology: Wound Healing and Hemoglobin Metabolism
tldr: This lecture discusses the insect as a medium for studying physiology, focusing on the processes of wound healing and the metabolism of hemoglobin in blood-sucking insects. The author demonstrates the ease with which physiological changes can be observed and studied in insects due to their small size, diverse species, and tolerance for various experimental conditions. The lecture provides examples of these processes, including the breakdown of hemoglobin in Rhodnius prolixus and the role of epidermal cells in wound healing.
